creditline: Gift of Arthur and Lucille Weiss
description: globular vessel, flat base, stirrup with centrally located vertical spout; 2 raised deer figures on cream slip background; base, deer, and spouts polished red clay
text: Deer held an important place in Moche society; they were the only animal to serve as substitutes for people during sacrificial rituals, and were likely only consumed by the elite. A symbol of elusiveness and agility, deer were frequently shown in scenes of war, often serving as the enemy fighting against the Moche. Here, the arrow-impaled deer is depicted with cream slip on a red clay background.
title: Globular vessel
